Name: Linear Programming
Description: Optimization of a linear objective function subject to linear equality and inequality constraints. The most fundamental and widely applied type.

Name: Mixed-Integer Linear Programming
Description: A linear programming problem where some or all decision variables are restricted to integer values. Adds combinatorial complexity.
Solvability: NP-Hard. Solution time can grow exponentially with size. Heuristics often used.

Name: Convex Optimization
Description: A broad class of problems where the objective function is convex and the constraint set is a convex set. LP is a subset.

Name: Nonlinear Programming
Description: Optimization where the objective function or constraints are nonlinear. A very broad category.
Solvability: Difficulty varies wildly. Can be NP-Hard. Often only local optima are found.

Name: Constraint Programming
Description: A paradigm for solving combinatorial problems stated as sets of constraints over decision variables. excels at feasibility and logical constraints.
Solvability: NP-Hard. Relies on powerful propagation and search techniques.

Name: Quadratic Programming
Description: A special case of NLP with a quadratic objective function and linear constraints. Common in finance and statistics.
Solvability: Efficiently solvable if the objective is convex (P).

Name: Stochastic Programming

Name: Robust Optimization
Description: Optimization under uncertainty seeking solutions that are feasible for all realizations of uncertain data within a predefined set.

Name: Dynamic Programming
Description: A method for solving complex problems by breaking them down into simpler subproblems. It is both a modeling framework and an algorithm.
Solvability: Can suffer from the "curse of dimensionality".
